title: nitrobetting
author: nitrobetting
content: 1. Our brain is designed to help us surviveOur brains have one goal. We create sub-goals, we may want to start a family, get rich, get a better job, make winning bets, etc.But to our brain, that‚Äôs all the same goal, to survive. When the brain loses the drive to survive, we fall into a depression.We must understand this drive to survive if we are to make winning sports bets. The drive to survive can lead us to making bad bets or to making bets with higher winning percentages. It all depends.The other thing about the drive to survive is that it is both a logical and emotional response. Emotions, fear, as an example, helps us survive. This isn‚Äôt the way our consciousness and mind think but it is the way our brain thinks.2. Know that our brain‚Äôs survival instinct always pushes us toward the negativeThe most significant aspect of our brain‚Äôs survival instinct is that it always pushes us towards the negative. Why?Our brains have yet to catch up to advancements in society. We understand blockchain and AI and how our iPhone works. But the survival instinct is more powerful than any of that.Always remember, that at the end of the day, our brains are built to help us survive. So emotions are always stronger and more difficult to control in the negative because while we know Chat GTP isn‚Äôt the Terminator, our brains see Chat GTP as the sabretooth tiger we had to run from when we lived in caves and hunted with spears.3. When our brain believes there will be a positive outcome, it releases endorphins, it‚Äôs important for us to understand thisEndorphins push us to the positive. So we could get ourselves in a loop, meaning we get excited about all the money we‚Äôre going to win by betting on the Cardinals to beat the 49ers because the Cards are a +450 money line underdog.Those endorphins tell us, ‚ÄúDo it! You‚Äôre going to be rich!‚Äù So, of course, we do it and then, when the 49ers beat the Cardinals by 30 we fall into a survival depression because we realize we needed the money we bet to pay rent.Doing something like the above doesn‚Äôt mean we have a gambling problem. It means we have to understand how our brain works. Then, we have to realize that our brain doesn‚Äôt understand things the way our mind and consciousness do.We can then pull our brain back by saying something simple like, ‚ÄúBrain, calm down.‚ÄùKeep reading‚Üí https://n2g.io/74f269a

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: I guess we really have to admit defeat though. And with that kind of mindset, our brain might tell us to stop gambling so that we still have our money in our pocket to pay our monthly rent.I think gamblers though know how brain works, but most of time we go against it. And it will take some experience if we wanted to have total control of it. Of course positive thinking might help, but I don't think that it will be a effective method though. What if this positive thinking fell? We don't have any plan B? So the best thing to do is once you understand that you might not win everytime, then your brain might tell you to to stop completely while you still have some money.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: This is an interesting topic which intrigues me, because it really looks contradictory that we get addicted to gambling, since our brains always look for survival instinct. It's like gambling lured our brains to believe that betting is positive for our survival through the profit we can make. Somehow our brains get immune to the threats signals gambling can be a bad thing if you are going too far. It's like there were a lion in front of you, but instead of running away from it, your brain executed the command of running to it. From a survival perspective it doesn't make any sense...

comments.author: Mahanton
comments.body: Totally depends on what you do have in mind on the time that you do play gambling because we know that there are people whom do treat gamblingas a main source of income or making themselves rich and to those people who do just simply play for the sake of entertainment and leisure.Our brain is indeed the main thing that we should really be needing to control and if you have that think that it is really that impossible to make money with gambling because of that basic principle thathouse do always win at the end then your emotions will definitely be getting in lined with it and on the time that you had lost up a session then you could easily moved on and stop for that particular moment or dayComparing into those people who had been thinking about making money and thinking on getting rich with gambling will really be having that kind of motive in mind.It all matters with your intent and belief on gambling because if you do really find yourself being delusional or believing in things which cant really be that possible then you would really be messing up in the end and this is where you would be having that miserable gambling experience that you wouldnt really be touching even once more on the time that you had devastated by it.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: The question is, it is really our brain that controls our emotion? Or our heart?And I doubt that as a gambler, we can win more games because of our brain being positive.I mean it's all about the odds and our extreme luck. If we have luck on our side, then we might go for more wins because we "feel", and our brain and heart tell us to play for more.So it's really very hard to control ones emotion, regardless if we are winning or losing. The only way to win more bets is to stop when you are winning and not go for another run.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: This detachment of yourself from your brain is a little absurd in my opinion. And while I know that in every case your brain takes the top spot over your conscious, that shouldn't mean you'd relinquish control over your own agency cause "you can't win against your brain anyway". As with gambling, you have a lot of ways and things you could employ that will help you from becoming addicted to gambling, controlling your emotions or not. It all boils down to assuming control and ensuring that you're not being abused by your own brain. I've seen one too many people fail at this and eventually succumb to gambling addiction, don't detach yourself from your brain, use it as a tool to make the most out of your gambling journey.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Your title is "How to Control Your Emotions and Win More Bets". And only tip you are giving is that we shouldn't bet on the underdog, because we would be betting on the underdog because of endorphins. Not betting on underdog might give you more seperate wins but it doesn't mean you would get better roi as it only takes 1 loss to undo several bets with low multiplierSo this doesn't really make much sense to me. Taking risks is the whole point of gambling. Without risks this wouldn't be called gambling.

comments.author: Cling18
comments.body: I think it's having the right mindset right from the beginning. It is important that we'll know our control and limitations right before we start gambling so we have set a complete goal and we are conditioning our emotions and mind before anything else. We all know how tricky gambling can be, there will be times where we could have long win streaks which will tempt us to bet more because of greed but we should be wiser than the result. Once we have win streaks, we should be smart enough to stop for a while and secure our profit than to continue betting where we could only end up chasing our losses. It's mind over matter and no matter how our urges may tempt us, we should know how to control our emotions or else, it will be the one to control us. Also, we should keep in mind the the possibility of losing will always exist as it isn't always glory days for us so we should always be ready for the possible results.

comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: I believe that the brain is the engine on which every other part of our body functions including our fears, anxiety or happiness. When we gamble, the brain send signal on the way we should feel depending on the outcome of the bet. So for example if the bet is a lose then we are likely to feel bad, if we are not sure of the winning potential of our game it is the brain that either make us have that anxiety or fear. So if we are able to get a balance of our emotion due to our winning rate then, we can make more progress and I think that is why sometimes when you are winning then you can be able to continue winning but a lose changes your countenance which also interacts with the brain. Therefore, a bad feeling may not be good for gambling and that could be the reason addicts lose more than profit.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: Controlling our emotions in gambling just basically means, we won't turn irresponsible along the way. It doesn't have to do with winning more bets especially if we refer to playing luck-based gambling games such as dice, slots, roulettes, and so on. Even on sports betting, controlling the emotion won't add even a bit of a percentage of chances of winning as what the emotion covers here is, the amount of bankroll that will be placed on a bet or analyzing what the best odds to choose - staying at average odds or risking more money at huge odds.It isn't really necessary to always keep in mind to control emotions, especially in gambling. There are other things to prioritize rather than that.As long as we continue to gamble, our emotions will automatically adapt to the situation.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Just limit the damn money you use on your bets by depositing only a specific amount instead of, well, everything. Your emotions can get in the way of you, but in the end, a gambling session (mostly for casinos I guess) is in the end a method for you to release emotions, to enjoy it more specifically. If you really want to win more bets, increase your bank roll and play more. The games always have a 50/50 (maybe less because of house edge) chance of win/loss most of the time, your emotions only influence how much you "play", not "win'.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: You can actually control how you react to certain things, so it's not an excuse that we are 'hardwired' into something when we can avoid them if we consciously wanted to. Again, being aware of what's the problem is always the hardest past of freeing yourself from impulsive decisions and bad habits related to gambling. A lot of people submits to the 'fact' that we cannot control what we are while in reality, it's the opposite.

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: If only it were that easy to tell our brains to calm down. But that's true because the brain tells us to do something we want to do. The brain gives the command, followed by the will and the body. But there is a heart that is also a filter of what we want to do. If the heart feels uncomfortable, the body will respond such as anxiety, worry, sweating, and others. When the brain still forces us to do something but the heart doesn't agree, that's where conflict occurs and can make us confused, and what's worse is that our head will hurt.But when the heart can control everything, the heart can calm the brain to calm down, which is immediately followed by the body responding too. And immediately, awareness will come to us by showing the impact. However, that is not always the case because the reactions can vary.
